member.name: M:ManageATenancyAPI.Controllers.v2.Tra.TRAController.Post(ManageATenancyAPI.UseCases.Meeting.SaveMeeting.Boundary.SaveETRAMeetingInputModel)
member.summary: Creates an ETRA meeting If the signoff object is provided then it will complete the meeting in one go If the signoff object is null then it will send out an email to the TRA representative stored in the database with a link to signoff the meeting with their name. In the second flow please post the signoff object via the Patch HttpMethod to complete the meeting
member.returns: A JSON object for a successfully created ETRA meeting request
member.response: A successfully created ETRA meeting request

member.name: T:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper
member.summary: The SqlHelper class is intended to encapsulate high performance, scalable best practices for common uses of SqlClient.

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of SqlParameters to a SqlCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
an array of SqlParameters tho be added to command

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Object[])
member.summary: This method assigns an array of values to an array of SqlParameters.
member.param: array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
array of objects holding the values to be assigned

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.PrepareCommand(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: This method opens (if necessary) and assigns a connection, transaction, command type and parameters to the provided command.
member.param: the SqlCommand to be prepared
a valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
a valid SqlTransaction, or 'null'
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
an array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: ExecuteAsync a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: an int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: ExecuteAsync a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
an array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: an int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: ExecuteAsync a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the name of the stored prcedure
an array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: an int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: ExecuteAsync a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the provided SqlConnection.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: a valid SqlConnection
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: an int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: T:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership
member.summary: this enum is used to indicate whether the connection was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper, so that we can set the appropriate CommandBehavior when calling ExecuteReader()

member.name: F:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership.Internal
member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by SqlHelper

member.name: F:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership.External
member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by the caller

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership)
member.summary: Create and prepare a SqlCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.
member.remarks:
If we created and opened the connection, we want the connection to be closed when the DataReader is closed.
If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.
member.param: a valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
a valid SqlTransaction, or 'null'
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
an array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
indicates whether the connection parameter was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper
member.returns: SqlDataReader containing the results of the command

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: ExecuteAsync a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders");
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: a SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: ExecuteAsync a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
an array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: a SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: ExecuteAsync a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the name of the stored procedure
an array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: a SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: ExecuteAsync a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the provided SqlConnection.
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders");
member.param: a valid SqlConnection
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: a SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelper.ExecuteScalar(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: ExecuteAsync a SqlCommand (that returns a 1x1 resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: int orderCount = (int)ExecuteScalar(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrderCount");
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: an object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command

member.name: T:LBH.Utils.SqlHelperParameterCache
member.summary: SqlHelperParameterCache provides functions to leverage a static cache of procedure parameters, and the ability to discover parameters for stored procedures at run-time.

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelperParameterCache.DiscoverSpParameterSet(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: resolve at run time the appropriate set of SqlParameters for a stored procedure
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the name of the stored procedure
whether or not to include their return value parameter

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelperParameterCache.CacheParameterSet(System.String,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: add parameter array to the cache
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
an array of SqlParamters to be cached

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelperParameterCache.GetCachedParameterSet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: retrieve a parameter array from the cache
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: an array of SqlParamters

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelperParameterCache.GetSpParameterSet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the set of SqlParameters appropriate for the stored procedure
member.remarks: This method will query the database for this information, and then store it in a cache for future requests.
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the name of the stored procedure
member.returns: an array of SqlParameters

member.name: M:LBH.Utils.SqlHelperParameterCache.GetSpParameterSet(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the set of SqlParameters appropriate for the stored procedure
member.remarks: This method will query the database for this information, and then store it in a cache for future requests.
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the name of the stored procedure
a bool value indicating whether the return value parameter should be included in the results
member.returns: an array of SqlParameters

member.name: T:LBH.Utils.Utils
member.summary: Summary description for Helpers
